comments.text:
Created attachment 567386
Screen shot 2011-10-17 at 4.54.45 PM.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111011182523

Steps to reproduce:

opening a page with somewhat larger image (1MB)


Actual results:

image displayed broken. see attached screenshot
the same issue observed with the latest firefox mobile beta (do not ask me which version because it is hidden)
to reproduce try flipping through images on http://valamit.com/2011/BestOf/page.html


Expected results:

full image display.
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111011182523

Steps to reproduce:

opening a page with somewhat larger image (1MB)


Actual results:

image displayed broken. see attached screenshot
the same issue observed with the latest firefox mobile beta (do not ask me which version because it is hidden)
to reproduce try flipping through images on http://valamit.com/2011/BestOf/page.html


Expected results:

full image display.

Is it really Firefox mobile (fennec)? The screenshot seems to show standard desktop Firefox in OS X.

Does it happen always on that page? Have you tried clearing your Firefox cache and also Safe mode https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode ?
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
Is it really Firefox mobile (fennec)? The screenshot seems to show standard desktop Firefox in OS X.

Does it happen always on that page? Have you tried clearing your Firefox cache and also Safe mode https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode ?
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk

comments.raw_text:
The issue appears with firefox 8 desktop version (mac os x)

But also noticed the same behaviour with the mobile beta version (fennec beta). 
the release fennec does not exhibit this behaviour.
comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.text:
The issue appears with firefox 8 desktop version (mac os x)

But also noticed the same behaviour with the mobile beta version (fennec beta). 
the release fennec does not exhibit this behaviour.

comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.text: thanks aceman, restarting in safe mode solved the issue, it must have been the webdeveloper or firebug addons that caused it i guess (i have no other extensions/addons running)
comments.raw_text: thanks aceman, restarting in safe mode solved the issue, it must have been the webdeveloper or firebug addons that caused it i guess (i have no other extensions/addons running)

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
It would still be good to know which one it was and why. Can you please follow it more?
Those are important addons I think and should not cause such problem. I have both of them I can try it too, but I do not have OS X.
comments.raw_text:
It would still be good to know which one it was and why. Can you please follow it more?
Those are important addons I think and should not cause such problem. I have both of them I can try it too, but I do not have OS X.

comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.text:
tested again with all plugins disabled.
the same broken image is displayed.

note: the broken image display happens randomly, not on every page load.
comments.raw_text:
tested again with all plugins disabled.
the same broken image is displayed.

note: the broken image display happens randomly, not on every page load.

Plugins?
This is the naming convention in Firefox:
The common name is "Addons". Those are of different types:
- extensions (like Firebug or Webdeveloper)
- plugins (like Adobe flash player)
- themes
- language packs

The types are shown in Tools->Addons in the left column.

So, which ones did you disable now? Do you take back comment 3 that either Firebug or Webdeveloper were causing it?
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
Plugins?
This is the naming convention in Firefox:
The common name is "Addons". Those are of different types:
- extensions (like Firebug or Webdeveloper)
- plugins (like Adobe flash player)
- themes
- language packs

The types are shown in Tools->Addons in the left column.

So, which ones did you disable now? Do you take back comment 3 that either Firebug or Webdeveloper were causing it?
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
Firefox beta mobile on android has the same error, so i think is safe to presume that is a firefox issue and not caused by addons or the NVIDIA GeForce GT 330M video card on mac os x.
actually is much easier to reproduce the error on the mobile version of beta firefox, because it happens almost always. (in contrast to the desktop version where the broken image is displayed in about 50% of tries)
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.text:
Firefox beta mobile on android has the same error, so i think is safe to presume that is a firefox issue and not caused by addons or the NVIDIA GeForce GT 330M video card on mac os x.
actually is much easier to reproduce the error on the mobile version of beta firefox, because it happens almost always. (in contrast to the desktop version where the broken image is displayed in about 50% of tries)

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text: Can you try running in normal mode (not safe mode) but disabling HW acceleration (options->advanced->general)?
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text: Can you try running in normal mode (not safe mode) but disabling HW acceleration (options->advanced->general)?

exactly the same bug observed in the release version of firefox 8.0 on Windows XP
enabling/disabling all plugins/extensions doesnt make a difference, the bug is still present.
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
exactly the same bug observed in the release version of firefox 8.0 on Windows XP
enabling/disabling all plugins/extensions doesnt make a difference, the bug is still present.

comments.creator: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text: Hmm, disabling hardware acceleration (on Windows XP) seems to be working, but i will have to test more
comments.author: gugurete@yahoo.com
comments.text: Hmm, disabling hardware acceleration (on Windows XP) seems to be working, but i will have to test more
